title: Setting up Angular 9
description: This articles explains how to setup Angular 9 from stratch

content.html: Google just released Angular 9 and it comes with some new features. In this article we see how to setup and run Angular 9 from scratch. This tutorial is for beginners who are new to Angular and who wants to explore all it has to offer.
In this tutorial we will learn how to run a simple Angular 9 application. We will be using Angular CLI tool for development
You will need NodeJS and npm package manage.
Node.js
Angular requires Node.js version 8.x or 10.x. To check your version, run
node -v
in a terminal/console window.
npm package manager
Angular, the Angular CLI, and Angular apps depend on features and functionality provided by libraries that are available as npm packages.
npm -v
run the above command to check npm version
You can read more about Node Package manage for more details. The following are the steps involved in setting up a new Angular application.
Install the Angular CLI
Angular CLI is used to create new projects, generate application and library code. We need to install Angular CLI globally
npm install -g @angular/cli
Creating an new Project
Angular applications are developed in workspace. Go to your desired directory and run the following command to generate a new workspace.
ng new my-app
The above command will create a folder called my-app. The applications name can be any name as per your requirements. It also creates the basic skeleton for the application.
Serve the application
Angular CLI can be used to run the application. You need to go to the project directory in command prompt or terminal in Linux and run the following command
ng serve --open
The --open will automatically open the browser and go to localhost:4200
Exploring Angular Application
You can use your favourite editor to open the application. Entire Angular application is build with building blocks called components. They are used to render data on the screen.
You will find many files present in the project directory. One among them is app.component.ts.

here, selectors are used to specify what tag we will need to use to print the component. If you had paid attention you will notice <app-root></app-root> in index.html. The entire application is rendered in that particular tag.
Just to explore, Change the title property from 'my-app' to 'My Angular App'.
You might have noticed that once you changed and hit save the browser will automatically refresh to get the new changes.
